reviews.review_msg: Lots of homework, tough grader (everyone in the program already has a degree - so she needs to improve in rubric creation), unwilling to be open to opinions. Not very good at all at the lesson delivery or planning her lessons. Most lessons left you wondering what the point was. She should focus on evidence-based pedagogical techniques.

This prof's strong suit is not pedagogy. She had non-sense rubrics and got all defensive and rude when given feedback about it. She marks unreasonably hard for good work and sometimes chooses inappropriate topics in class to discuss like blood transfusions? Unlike most EDUC courses she expects you to buy a textbook. She is slow to respond to emails

Ami would do well to find herself a position in which her skillset and personality are more aligned with delivering some sort of good or useful product to a different group of people or industry. She lacks basic pedagogical awareness (not surprising considering she doesn't have a degree in education)
